stories.title: 11-year-old discovers ancient turtle fossil on BLM land
stories.summary: An 11-year-old rockhound named Touren Pope made an incredible discovery while exploring public land in Wyoming: a fossilized turtle dating back nearly 48 million years! This remarkable find not only showcases the wonders of our planet's history but also highlights the joy of exploration and curiosity in young minds.

stories.title: Is being virtuous good for you – or just people around you? A study suggests traits like compassion may support your own well-being
stories.summary: A recent study suggests that embodying virtues like compassion and patience can enhance not only the well-being of those around you but also your own. This research adds to the age-old debate on the importance of virtue, showing that being kind can be a win-win for everyone involved.

stories.title: Teacher shocked as he's presented with £94,000 supercar outside school
stories.summary: A teacher's luck took a surprising turn when he won a £94,000 supercar just weeks after losing his previous car in an accident. Jeff Taylor's incredible win from a mere 22p raffle ticket has left him in shock and serves as a reminder that life can throw unexpected blessings our way.

stories.title: Snowplow driver saves stranded motorist in Indianapolis
stories.summary: In a heartwarming moment during a heavy snowfall in Indianapolis, a snowplow driver came to the rescue of a stranded motorist. Jose Trejo was stuck, but thanks to the quick action of the driver, he was able to get back on the road, showcasing the power of community support in tough situations.

stories.title: Nelson donates kidney to cousin: ‘Huge gift’
stories.summary: Lacey Nelson made a life-changing decision by donating her kidney to her cousin, Max Amsden, who was in desperate need of a transplant. This act of generosity not only saved a life but also deepened their family bond, showcasing the incredible impact of selfless giving.

stories.title: Otter Tail County appraiser commended for compassionate care during crisis
stories.summary: Todd Finkelson, an appraiser in Otter Tail County, was recognized for his compassionate response during a crisis when he intervened to help someone in distress. His quick thinking and care for others exemplify the profound impact one person can have in a moment of need.

stories.title: Blue Spring State Park proves accessibility belongs in nature
stories.summary: A family hike turned into a transformative experience for Mitch Geier, a double amputee, as he enjoyed the beauty of nature at Blue Spring State Park. This outing not only highlighted the importance of accessibility in outdoor spaces but also demonstrated how nature can inspire resilience and joy.

stories.title: World's oldest known rock art predates modern humans' entrance into Europe — and it was found in an Indonesian cave
stories.summary: Scientists have uncovered the world's oldest known rock art in an Indonesian cave, dating back at least 67,800 years. This hand stencil not only represents a significant archaeological find but also provides insight into the early presence of modern humans in the region.

stories.title: Downtown church takes rare step amid cold, opens doors as overnight shelter
stories.summary: In a remarkable act of compassion, St. Paul’s Cathedral in London opened its doors as an overnight shelter for the homeless during extreme cold weather. This historic cathedral welcomed around 50 individuals, providing them warmth and safety, showcasing the power of community support.

stories.title: Huntington’s Disease Has Local Man Walking/Running Causeway Bridge Daily
stories.summary: Rip Wagner, a former physical education teacher, has turned his daily walks over a Causeway bridge into a powerful testament to resilience while living with Huntington’s disease. His commitment to movement and exercise serves as an inspiring reminder of the strength found in perseverance.

stories.title: Local students join forces to combat hunger in Georgia and Kentucky
stories.summary: Students from Lanier High School's band and football team have united to combat hunger in Georgia and Kentucky. Partnering with Meals to Missions, they are making a meaningful impact by addressing food insecurity in their communities, showcasing the strength of youth activism.

stories.title: Heroic Central New York Police Officer Getting National Attention
stories.summary: Officer Jamie Pastorello from Syracuse has captured hearts nationwide after he offered a ride to a woman struggling with groceries in freezing weather. His simple act of kindness highlights the importance of compassion and community, proving that small gestures can make a big difference.

stories.title: Orlando VA Program Uses Dungeons & Dragons to Support Veteran Wellness
stories.summary: At the Orlando VA Healthcare System, veterans are finding healing and connection through the REVEAL Program, which uses Dungeons & Dragons as a therapeutic tool. This innovative approach fosters emotional wellness, transforming the way veterans engage with their mental health.

stories.title: AI predicts future disease risk using sleep patterns
stories.summary: Stanford researchers have developed an innovative AI model named SleepFM that predicts future disease risks based on sleep patterns. This groundbreaking tool highlights the significant impact of sleep on overall health, beyond just mood and energy levels, paving the way for better health management.

stories.title: This Minnesota Bar Was Built From 300-Year Old Wood
stories.summary: Discover the Trestle Inn in Minnesota, a bar built from wood reclaimed from a 300-year-old railroad bridge. This unique establishment not only serves ice-cold beer but also carries a rich history, blending nostalgia with modern socializing.

stories.title: This DIY Genius Has Powered His Entire Home With Old Laptop Batteries Since 2016
stories.summary: One innovative homeowner has turned e-waste into a sustainable energy source, powering his entire home with old laptop batteries since 2016. This DIY genius demonstrates how creativity and resourcefulness can lead to a more resilient and eco-friendly lifestyle.

stories.title: Why simply saying ‘hello’ makes the world better
stories.summary: In a world dominated by technology, the simple act of greeting one another can make a significant difference. A recent article highlights how saying 'hello' can revitalize our communities, fostering connections and making our neighborhoods feel more alive.

stories.title: At 408 mph, this drone has just set a Guinness-certified record and the best part is, it was entirely built in-house using a 3D printer
stories.summary: A father-son duo in South Africa has set a Guinness World Record by building a 3D-printed drone that reached an astonishing speed of 408 mph. This achievement showcases the incredible potential of DIY technology and innovation in the modern age.

stories.title: North Carolina Amazon Driver From Charlotte Donates Entire $10,000 Reward to Local Children’s Hospital After Receiving Record Customer Thanks
stories.summary: After being recognized as one of Amazon's most-thanked drivers, GreyIon Anthony from Charlotte made headlines by donating his entire $10,000 reward to a local children's hospital. His selfless act of generosity highlights the impact of kindness and community support.

stories.title: The 40-Year Career that Quietly Helped Redefine an Arkansas Gas Utility
stories.summary: Fred Kirkwood's 40-year career has been shaped by love and dedication, starting from his college days to redefining an Arkansas gas utility. His journey reflects the power of personal connections and the transformative impact of pursuing one's passion.

stories.title: Central Oregon innovator nears launch of flying car
stories.summary: After nearly two decades of hard work, Central Oregon innovator Sam Bousfield is on the brink of launching a flying car that can drive on streets and take off from small airports. This groundbreaking project could revolutionize transportation and bring science fiction closer to reality.

stories.title: Uncovering the Extraordinary Life of Joseph Reynolds
stories.summary: As Ireland commemorates its revolutionary history, a researcher has unveiled the remarkable life of Joseph Reynolds, a man who dedicated fifty years to serving multiple causes. His story highlights the complexities of identity and commitment during a transformative era.

stories.title: Man goes from homelessness to helping
stories.summary: A veteran who once faced homelessness is now helping others through the VA Peer Support Program. By sharing his experiences, he fosters connections that are crucial for recovery, showing how personal journeys can inspire collective healing.

stories.title: Columbia Falls runners complete 24-hour run-a-thon to support injured teammate
stories.summary: Columbia Falls High School cross country teammates came together to complete a 24-hour run-a-thon, raising funds for their injured teammate, Hazel Alexander. Their dedication not only supports her recovery but also strengthens their bond as a team.

stories.title: The Artemis 2 Astronauts Will Observe Parts of the Moon Humans Have Never Laid Eyes On
stories.summary: NASA's Artemis 2 mission is set to make history as astronauts prepare to fly by the Moon for the first time in over 50 years. This mission will not only test new spaceflight technologies but also pave the way for humanity's return to the lunar surface.

stories.title: Iqaluit students turn science and math into a business
stories.summary: Students at Iqaluit's École des Trois-Soleils are turning their science and math skills into a thriving business through their robotics club. By filling custom orders for 3D-printed products, they are blending education with entrepreneurship in an exciting way.

stories.title: Owners of San Francisco restaurants offer housing to employees
stories.summary: In a heartening move, the owners of Rich Table in San Francisco are offering housing to their employees in newly furnished apartments above their restaurant. This initiative not only supports their staff but also fosters a sense of community and belonging.

stories.title: Calf Rescued from Harmony Coast Cliff After Being Missing for Over a Week
stories.summary: A dramatic rescue unfolded as firefighters saved a stranded 5-month-old calf from a steep coastal cliff after it had been missing for over a week. This heroic effort highlights the dedication of first responders and the community's commitment to animal welfare.

stories.title: Fall River standout multi-sport athlete has begun the fight of his young life with community support
stories.summary: Wesley Araujo, a standout multi-sport athlete from Fall River, is now facing the challenge of his life as he battles leukemia. With the unwavering support of his community, he channels his competitive spirit into this fight for recovery.

stories.title: Her ancestors were expelled from Spain. Now she’s bringing bagels to Madrid.
stories.summary: Tamara Cohen is bridging her family's Sephardic history with a modern twist by bringing bagels to Madrid, a city that lacked them until now. Her journey reflects a personal transformation and the revival of cultural heritage through culinary innovation.

stories.title: From Rescues To Smiles: How Pamela Kramer Glickman Built San Diego’s Beloved Pammy’s Pony Parties Mobile Petting Zoo
stories.summary: Pamela Kramer Glickman turned a life-changing rescue of a newborn lamb into a beloved mobile petting zoo, Pammy's Pony Parties, in San Diego. This heartwarming venture not only brings joy to children and families but also highlights the deep bond between humans and animals, fostering community connections through shared experiences.

stories.title: Neighbors helping neighbors: Friendship Circle volunteers bring warmth in the cold
stories.summary: In the face of dangerously low temperatures, volunteers at Friendship Circle Café and Bakery came together to prepare warm meals for neighbors in need. Their collective effort not only provided nourishment but also fostered a sense of community spirit and support during a challenging time.

stories.title: Could a drug slow aging? UW-Madison researchers seek answers in trial
stories.summary: Researchers at UW-Madison are exploring the potential of rapamycin, a drug typically used for organ transplant patients, to slow aging in humans. This groundbreaking study could pave the way for new treatments that enhance both the quality and longevity of life, sparking excitement in the field of gerontology.

stories.title: St.Landry Parish warming shelter offers hope amid freeze
stories.summary: As freezing temperatures hit St. Landry Parish, local leaders have opened a warming shelter to provide refuge for those in need. Offering beds and hot meals, this initiative is a beacon of hope for the community, ensuring that no one is left out in the cold.

stories.title: Utah man with rare facial condition sees his life story told on the big screen
stories.summary: Ben Kjar, a Utah man with a rare facial condition, is inspiring audiences nationwide with his documentary, 'STANDOUT: The Ben Kjar Story.' His journey of overcoming adversity is now shared on the big screen, aiming to inspire others facing their own challenges.

stories.title: Mason City birthday party turns extra wild after guest wins $100K lottery prize
stories.summary: A birthday party in Mason City turned into an unforgettable celebration when Alyea Carter Greenan won a $100K lottery prize while scratching tickets with her family. The joyous chaos that erupted in the room made for a birthday bash that no one will soon forget!

stories.title: The Man Who Showed That Faith and Reason Align
stories.summary: A thought-provoking exploration reveals how faith and reason can coexist harmoniously. This narrative challenges the common belief that they are opposites, encouraging a deeper understanding of how both can enrich our lives and perspectives.

stories.title: Markey study finds targeted radiation therapy can be safely combined with chemotherapy
stories.summary: A groundbreaking study from the University of Kentucky reveals that targeted radiation therapy can safely be combined with high-dose chemotherapy. This innovative approach could significantly improve treatment outcomes for patients battling stage IV cancer, marking a promising advancement in cancer care.

stories.title: 200K bikes, 200K readers: CYCLE rewrites kids’ futures one bike at a time
stories.summary: CYCLE has reached an incredible milestone by distributing its 200,000th bike to children who achieve their reading goals. This initiative not only promotes literacy but also empowers young learners in Title I schools, proving that a bike can be a powerful tool for change.

stories.title: New Redmond Drone Program Is Changing Emergency Response
stories.summary: Redmond, WA, is enhancing its emergency response capabilities with a new drone program that promises faster response times and improved safety. This innovative approach is set to transform how the community addresses emergencies, showcasing the potential of technology in public safety.

stories.title: Omaha native rows solo across Atlantic in World’s Toughest Row
stories.summary: Omaha native Taryn Smith is taking on the challenge of a lifetime by rowing solo across the Atlantic Ocean in the World’s Toughest Row. After nearly three years of preparation, she’s competing in a grueling 3,000-mile race, showcasing her determination and resilience as she navigates the high seas.

stories.title: Ridiculously Cute Coastal Martens are Secretive, OSU Scientists are Getting to Know Them
stories.summary: Oregon State University researchers are shedding light on the elusive coastal marten, a small carnivore on the brink of extinction. Their three-month study aims to better understand this adorable creature, helping to ensure its survival and highlighting the importance of wildlife conservation.

stories.title: FDNY paramedics help deliver baby at Whitehall Ferry Terminal
stories.summary: Two FDNY paramedics made headlines after assisting with the delivery of a baby at the Whitehall Ferry Terminal. Their quick thinking and dedication not only brought new life into the world but also exemplified the heroism and compassion of first responders.

stories.title: Newborn puppies saved after being left in box
stories.summary: Nine newborn puppies were saved by the San Marcos Regional Animal Shelter after being abandoned in a box. Thanks to the swift actions of the shelter staff and rescue partners, these tiny pups received the urgent care they needed, showcasing the community's commitment to animal welfare.

stories.title: Celebrating Evelyn Harris: Her voice filled the room again
stories.summary: The celebration of life for acclaimed singer Evelyn Harris brought together family, friends, and fans to honor her legacy. In a touching tribute, her voice filled the room once again, reminding everyone of the joy and impact she had on their lives.

stories.title: Oral Surgeon Fixes Smiles, Transforms Lives in Bangladesh
stories.summary: Oral surgeon John Wallace and his team from Smile Bangladesh are changing lives one smile at a time. For over two decades, they have repaired cleft lips and palates, providing hope and transformation to countless individuals in Bangladesh, where such surgeries are rare.

stories.title: Beloved mini horse missing as community rallies to help
stories.summary: The community has rallied around the owner of Ricky, a beloved mini horse who has touched many lives as a therapy and educational animal. As Ricky goes missing, the outpouring of support showcases the deep connections formed between animals and their human friends.

stories.title: Tiny falcons are helping keep the food supply safe on cherry farms
stories.summary: American kestrels are playing a crucial role in maintaining the health of cherry farms in northern Michigan by controlling pest populations. This natural solution not only benefits the farmers but also highlights the importance of biodiversity and the interconnectedness of ecosystems.

stories.title: Young cancer survivor from Alexandria celebrated New Year’s with surprise Caps tickets
stories.summary: Sutton Bullard, a young cancer survivor, experienced a magical New Year’s Eve when she received surprise tickets to see her favorite hockey team, the Caps. This special moment not only celebrated her resilience but also brought joy and excitement as she reunited with her favorite player.

stories.title: FlashTags Could Revolutionize Livestock Protection In The West
stories.summary: A new technology involving illuminated livestock could revolutionize how ranchers protect their animals from predators. This innovative approach aims to reduce losses for farmers while adding a quirky twist to livestock management.
